objectives: Understand common words used in weather reports
Follow simple weather forecasts given in audio
Use weather information to plan daily and farming activities

sections.text: A weather report tells us about the weather conditions of a place. It tells us if it will be sunny, rainy, hot, or cold. These reports are very important for everyone, especially for farmers in the village. They help us know what kind of day to expect so we can plan our work and activities. We can hear weather reports on the radio, on TV, or sometimes from people who listen to these reports regularly and share the news.

sections.text: Listening to weather reports helps us in many ways. Farmers need to know about rain for their crops or about strong winds for their fields. Others need to know if it's hot to carry enough water, or if it's cold to wear warm clothes. It helps us decide if we should go to the market, play outside, or stay indoors. It is important for our daily life and safety.

sections.text: Temperature tells us how hot or cold the air is. We use special words to describe different temperatures. 'Celsius' is a way to measure temperature. For example, '30 degrees Celsius' means it is hot. Remember that numbers like 0 degrees Celsius means very cold, water freezes. 40 degrees Celsius means very hot.

sections.text: There are other words that are useful in weather reports. 'Forecast' or 'prediction' means telling what the weather will be like in the future. 'Climate' is the usual weather of a place over a very long time, like how our village always has hot summers and rainy monsoons. 'Season' is a part of the year with certain weather, like summer, winter, monsoon.

sections.text: Weather reports usually give information for different times: for 'today', for 'tonight', for 'tomorrow', and sometimes for the 'next few days' or 'next week'. sections.text: When listening to a weather report, try to catch these main pieces of information: the temperature (hot or cold and how many degrees), the type of weather (sunny, rainy, cloudy, stormy), and any warnings (like for heavy rain, strong winds, or flood danger). These are the most important details for your daily decisions.

sections.text: Weather reports are very important for farmers. Knowing the weather helps them decide when to plant seeds, when to water crops, when to spray medicine on plants, and most importantly, when to harvest. Good planning can save crops from damage and bring a better harvest.

examples.label: Protecting from cold

examples.label: Protecting from hail

sections.text: Weather reports help everyone in their daily life too. Knowing the weather helps you choose what clothes to wear, whether to carry an umbrella, or if children can play outside. It also helps with safety, like knowing when to stay indoors during a storm or when it is safe to travel. We must always take warnings seriously.
